aboutIntro: InvApp is a tool designed for modern investors who want to identify undervalued stocks using principles inspired by Peter Lynch's legendary investment strategies.
aboutMissionText: To make value investing simple, accessible, and intuitive for everyone – from beginners to experienced investors.
aboutHowText: I analyze company fundamentals, simulate Lynch's screening methods, and present user-friendly insights into stock value, growth potential, and history.
aboutTeamText: Built by passionate developer and financial enthusiast, InvApp is an open-source project evolving through user feedback and continuous innovation.

stockDetails.description: This is a placeholder description for the company. In the future, it will be replaced by real API data.

main.title: Welcome to InvApp
main.subtitle: Discover undervalued stocks based on Peter Lynch's strategy.

homeHero.description: This app helps investors select undervalued stocks inspired by Peter Lynch's approach.
homeHero.notes: These are mostly small-cap companies with high growth potential. The list is sorted by increasing undervaluation based on P/E.
homeHero.frontendOnly: This is the front-end version and works exclusively with public APIs. To unlock the full potential, use the version with a connected back end.

aboutPage.title: About Undervalued Stocks App
aboutPage.lead: A research-first frontend to surface potentially undervalued stocks. We use open/public APIs only and respect their terms.

features.title: What’s included now
features.finvizText: Home shows stocks from Finviz screening. Cards render instantly with lightweight fields.
features.prefetchText: After a page loads, we progressively prefetch next pages in the background until ~200 tickers are ready.
features.detailsText: “View Details” pulls live quotes and a lightweight profile on demand.
features.newsText: Compact news column plus a side panel: Top Gainers when the market is open, a market-closed card otherwise.
features.favText: Star tickers to keep them handy while browsing multiple pages.
features.uiText: Modern grid, skeletons for instant feedback, memoized cards, and gentle animations.

sources.title: APIs & Data Sources

finviz.text: Primary source for the home-page universe and initial card fields (tickers, names, basic attributes).

finnhub.text: Used for live quotes, lightweight profiles, and universal search by ticker/company.

sec.text: Public US filings accessed programmatically for factual checkpoints where applicable.

candles.name: Price candles (fallback chain)
candles.text: Historical OHLC retrieval uses a resilient chain to avoid hard failures; falls back safely.

sources.note: We use only open/public endpoints and do not redistribute proprietary content. All trademarks belong to their owners.

legal.title: Legal & Compliance
legal.openText: We fetch data from publicly available APIs and respect each provider’s terms and fair-use limits.
legal.copyrightText: We don’t mirror, sell, or republish proprietary data; caches are transient and UX-bound.
legal.naText: The app is for research/education only and does not constitute financial advice.
legal.attrText: Company names, tickers, logos, and marks are used nominatively to identify securities and sources.
legal.privacyText: We don’t collect personal financial data. API keys live in environment variables.

roadmap.title: Roadmap snapshot
roadmap.filtersText: Advanced filters, saved views, and richer symbol suggestions.
roadmap.detailsText: More fundamentals, risk flags, blended fair-value heuristics.
roadmap.perfText: Prefetch tuning, smarter concurrency, and graceful back-offs.

aboutPage.footer: Have ideas or found an issue? We’d love your feedback.
